stanza.line: How sweet and lovely dost thou make the (a)shame(/a)
Which like a canker in the fragrant (b)rose(/b)
Doth spot the beauty of thy budding (a)name(/a)
O in what sweets dost thou thy sins (b)enclose(/b)
That tongue that tells the story of thy (c)days(/c)
Cannot dispraise but in a kind of (c)praise(/c)
Naming thy name blesses an ill (d)report(/d)
O what a mansion have those vices (e)got(/e)
Which for their habitation chose out (f)thee(/f)
Where beauty's veil doth cover every (e)blot(/e)
And all things turns to fair that eyes can (f)see(/f)
Take heed (dear heart) of this large (g)privilege(/g)
The hardest knife ill-used doth lose his (g)edge(/g)
